repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

verification.payload:
tree e1d313354e77014f6b55e91a30fefe78d384c78e
parent e39d954f118a29db2c33e9a9a507053fff5573ed
author Tim Ruffing <crypto@timruffing.de> 1678186883 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1678186883 +0100

Update Changelog

Fixes #1220.

events.body: The release process also [reminds us to add a section on ABI compatibility](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/blob/master/doc/release-process.md#regular-release). As far as I am aware, there has been no changes that affect the ABI but not the API.  The ABI is backward incompatible for the same reason the API is backward incompatible (changed handling of static contexts). But this doesn't need to be added in this PR.

> As far as I am aware, there has been no changes that affect the ABI but not the API. The ABI is backward incompatible for the same reason the API is backward incompatible (changed handling of static contexts).

This looks correct to me. (Indeed, if an old consumer program is linked against our new library, the new library could break call the illegal callback if the consumer tries to (for example) randomize the static context.)

> . But this doesn't need to be added in this PR.

Do you want to give it a try and also increase the ABI numbers?

issue.title: release: prepare for 0.3.0
issue.body:
Based on #1221. The release date is set to tomorrow March 8th. This is a draft because we only want to merge this tomorrow and  make sure to tag the release immediately afterwards. 

`make dist` does not miss files as shown by this diff between the dist tar.gz and a clean checkout of the repo:
```
❯ diff -qr . ../../../secp256k1-clean
Only in .: aclocal.m4
Only in ./build-aux: ar-lib
Only in ./build-aux: compile
Only in ./build-aux: config.guess
Only in ./build-aux: config.sub
Only in ./build-aux: depcomp
Only in ./build-aux: install-sh
Only in ./build-aux: ltmain.sh
Only in ./build-aux/m4: libtool.m4
Only in ./build-aux/m4: lt~obsolete.m4
Only in ./build-aux/m4: ltoptions.m4
Only in ./build-aux/m4: ltsugar.m4
Only in ./build-aux/m4: ltversion.m4
Only in ./build-aux: missing
Only in ./build-aux: test-driver
Files ./CHANGELOG.md and ../../../secp256k1-clean/CHANGELOG.md differ
Only in ../../../secp256k1-clean: ci
Only in ../../../secp256k1-clean: .cirrus.yml
Only in .: configure
Files ./configure.ac and ../../../secp256k1-clean/configure.ac differ
Only in ../../../secp256k1-clean: .git
Only in ../../../secp256k1-clean: .gitattributes
Only in ../../../secp256k1-clean: .gitignore
Only in .: Makefile.in
```

issue.title: Upstream PRs 1160, 1193, 1169, 1190, 1192, 1194, 1196, 1195, 1170, 1172, 1200, 1199, 1203, 1201, 1206, 1078, 1209, 979, 1212, 1218, 1217, 1221, 1222
issue.body:
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1160]: Makefile: add `-I$(top_srcdir)/{include,src}` to `CPPFLAGS` for precomputed
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1193]: Add `noverify_tests` to `.gitignore`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1169]: Add support for msan instead of valgrind (for memcheck and ctime test)
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1190]: Make all non-API functions (except main) static
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1192]: Switch to exhaustive groups with small B coefficient
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1194]: Ensure safety of ctz_debruijn implementation.
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1196]: Drop no longer used variables from the build system
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1195]: ctime_tests: improve output when CHECKMEM_RUNNING is not defined
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1170]: contexts: Forbid destroying, cloning and randomizing the static context
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1172]: benchmarks: fix bench_scalar_split
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1200]: Drop no longer used Autoheader macros
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1199]: ci: Minor improvements inspired by Bitcoin Core
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1203]: Do not link `bench` and `ctime_tests` to `COMMON_LIB`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1201]: ci: Do not set git's `user.{email,name}` config options
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1206]: build: Add -Wreserved-identifier supported by clang
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1078]: group: Save a normalize_to_zero in gej_add_ge
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1209]: build: Add SECP256K1_API_VAR to fix importing variables from DLLs
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#979]: Native jacobi symbol algorithm
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1212]: Prevent dead-store elimination when clearing secrets in examples
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1218]: Update overflow check
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1217]: Add secp256k1_fe_add_int function
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1221]: Update Changelog
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1222]: Remove redundant checks.

- made -zkp functions static where possible
- CTIMETEST -> CTIMETESTS
- VG_CHECK_VERIFY(r->n, sizeof(r->n)); -> SECP256K1_CHECKMEM_CHECK_VERIFY

The next PR introduces cmake.
